title: Why CO₂ can be high indoors
text: High indoor CO₂ usually comes from people breathing in closed rooms, poor ventilation, sealed windows, or gas appliances. Increase fresh air and reduce sources.

title: Immediate steps for CO alarm
text: Take CO alarms seriously. Ventilate immediately by opening doors and windows, move to fresh air, turn off sources, and call emergency services if anyone has symptoms.

title: What PM2.5 means
text: PM2.5 are fine particles ≤2.5 micrometers. They penetrate deep into lungs. Common sources: cooking smoke, candles, dust. Ventilation and filtration help reduce them.

title: Kitchen ventilation tips
text: Use the range hood while cooking and afterwards. Open a window for cross-ventilation. Clean filters regularly. Avoid blocking air inlets.

title: Silencing the alarm
text: In this project, silence the AirNode buzzer by pressing its button for ~3 seconds or sending 'alarm:off' via dashboard. Always fix the source, not just the sound.

title: When to seek help
text: If air quality remains poor despite ventilation, or anyone feels unwell, stop sources, move to fresh air, and contact a technician or emergency services.

title: Safe CO₂ levels
text: Outdoor CO₂ ~400 ppm. Indoors, >1000 ppm means poor ventilation, >2000 ppm may cause drowsiness. Always ventilate when above 1000 ppm.

title: Health effects of CO exposure
text: CO binds to hemoglobin, reducing oxygen delivery. Symptoms: headache, dizziness, nausea. Severe exposure: unconsciousness or death. Ventilate and evacuate immediately.

title: Safe PM2.5 thresholds
text: WHO 24-hour guideline ≤15 µg/m³. Above 35 µg/m³ is unhealthy, especially for sensitive groups. Reduce sources and improve ventilation.

title: StoveNode fan control
text: Fan removes smoke and heat. It turns on automatically at high stove temperatures, but users may keep it on manually for extra ventilation.

title: Regular maintenance
text: Check sensor calibration every 6–12 months. Replace filters regularly. Keep stove area clean and ensure ducts are not blocked.

title: Alarm sound meaning
text: Continuous alarm = danger. Short beep = low battery or fault. Always investigate the cause.

title: Safe stove temperature
text: Normal cooking ≤200°C. If stove surface >250°C unsupervised, system triggers alarm and fan.

title: Why humidity matters
text: Comfortable range: 40–60%. High humidity causes mold; low humidity causes dryness.

title: Symptoms of high CO₂
text: Mild: drowsiness, poor concentration. Severe: headaches, nausea. Improve ventilation immediately.

title: Symptoms of high PM2.5
text: Irritation of eyes, throat, coughing, asthma flare-ups. Reduce indoor sources and ventilate.

title: Symptoms of high CO
text: Headache, dizziness, confusion. Severe: fainting. Always treat as emergency.

title: Dashboard usage
text: Users can see real-time sensor data, historical trends, and control actuators via the dashboard.

title: Buzzer purpose
text: The buzzer provides immediate audible alerts when dangerous thresholds are exceeded.

title: Fan purpose
text: The fan improves air circulation and helps remove harmful gases and smoke.

title: CO₂ sensor info
text: The AirNode CO₂ sensor provides calibrated readings in ppm for indoor air quality monitoring.

title: CO sensor info
text: The CO sensor detects carbon monoxide levels in ppm to prevent poisoning.

title: PM sensor info
text: The particulate matter sensor measures PM1.0, PM2.5, PM10 levels to detect smoke and dust.

title: Temperature sensor info
text: The DHT22 measures temperature and humidity for comfort and safety insights.

title: When to open windows
text: Open windows when CO₂ >1000 ppm, PM2.5 is high, or stove is producing smoke.

title: Why ventilation is key
text: Ventilation dilutes pollutants, lowers CO₂ and CO, and brings fresh air indoors.

title: Why filtration matters
text: Air filters remove particles and allergens. Clean or replace them regularly.

title: Power failure behavior
text: If power fails, devices reconnect automatically when restored. Alarms resume normal operation.

title: Data storage
text: All sensor readings are stored in the database for historical analysis and safety audits.

title: CSV export
text: Users can export historical data in CSV format from the dashboard.

title: AI Assistant role
text: SHEGA Assistant explains air quality, stove safety, and provides actionable advice.

title: Low battery warning
text: Short beeps indicate low battery in devices. Replace or recharge batteries promptly.

title: Smoke detection
text: PM sensor detects smoke particles. Alarms activate if levels rise dangerously.

title: Fire prevention
text: Never leave cooking unattended. Keep flammable items away from stove.

title: Children safety
text: Teach children not to tamper with sensors or alarms. Ensure stove area is safe.

title: Elderly safety
text: Ensure alarms are loud enough. Provide visual indicators for hearing-impaired users.

title: Pet safety
text: Pets are sensitive to smoke and CO. Keep indoor air clean and safe.

title: Smart thermostat benefit
text: Smart thermostats can adjust temperature and airflow based on occupancy.

title: Why avoid candles
text: Candles release PM2.5 and CO₂. Use alternatives like LED lights.

title: Incense smoke
text: Burning incense produces fine particles and gases. Ventilate well if used.

title: Cooking smoke
text: Frying or grilling produces particles and gases. Always use ventilation.

title: Dust buildup
text: Dust increases PM levels. Regular cleaning reduces indoor pollutants.

title: Car exhaust risk
text: Running cars in garages produces CO. Never idle a car indoors.

title: Sensor faults
text: Unusual readings may mean sensor fault. Check connections and recalibrate.

title: Calibration
text: Calibrate sensors outdoors in clean air for accuracy.

title: Emergency contacts
text: Always have emergency numbers accessible in case of CO or fire incidents.

title: Why sleep quality matters
text: High CO₂ at night can cause restless sleep. Ventilate bedrooms.

title: Humidity and health
text: Too dry air irritates skin and throat. Too humid causes mold. Balance is key.

title: Why log history
text: Historical data helps track air trends and improve safety practices.

title: Role of SHEGA
text: SHEGA Assistant helps you understand data, alerts you to dangers, and guides safe actions.

title: ለምን የ CO₂ መጠን ይጨምራል?
text: በተዘጉ ክፍሎች ውስጥ መተንፈስ፣ መናፈሻ እጥረት እና ጋዝ መሳሪያ በመጠቀም የ CO₂ መጠን ይጨምራል።

title: የ CO አስጠንቀቂ መሳሪያ
text: አስጠንቀቂውን በጥርጥር ይውሰዱ። መስኮቶችን ክፈቱ፣ ነፃ አየር ያስገቡ፣ ምንጮችን ይዝጉ።

title: PM2.5 ምንድነው?
text: PM2.5 ከ 2.5 ማይክሮ ሜትር ያነሱ ትንንሽ ቅንጣቶች ናቸው። ምንጮች የምግብ ጭስ፣ ካንድል፣ ትቢያ።

title: የምድጃ መናፈሻ
text: ምግብ ሲዘጋጅ የምድጃ እቃ ማውጫ ይጠቀሙ፣ መስኮት ይክፈቱ፣ ማጣሪያን ንጹህ ያድርጉ።

title: አላርም ማጥፋት
text: በዚህ ፕሮጀክት ውስጥ አላርምን በ 3 ሰከንድ ቁልፍ በመጫን ወይም 'alarm:off' በመላክ ይዝጉ።

title: መናፈሻ እጥረት
text: ከ 1000 ppm በላይ የ CO₂ መጠን መናፈሻ እጥረት ያመለክታል።

title: የ CO ምልክቶች
text: ራስ ምታት፣ ማዞር፣ የማቅለሽለሽ ስሜት። ከባድ ከሆነ ማድረስ ይችላል።

title: PM2.5 አደጋ
text: ከ 35 µg/m³ በላይ አየር ጥራት አያስፈልግም። መናፈሻን አድርጉ።

title: እንቅልፍና CO₂
text: ከፍተኛ የ CO₂ መጠን በሌሊት እንቅልፍን ያጎዳል። መስኮት ይክፈቱ።

title: የትቢያ ምንጮች
text: ትቢያ፣ ካርፔት እና ተጠርጣሪ እቃዎች የ PM ምንጮች ናቸው።

title: አየር ማጣሪያ
text: ማጣሪያ በቀን ቀን ማነጽ እና መቀየር ያስፈልጋል።

title: ሙቀት ከፍተኛ
text: ከ 250°C በላይ የምድጃ ሙቀት አደጋ ይመስላል።

title: እርጥበት
text: 40–60% የሚሆነው የእርጥበት ደረጃ ተመጣጣኝ ነው።

title: አላርም ድምፅ
text: ድምፅ ቀጥታ = አደጋ። አንድ ደቂቃ በኩል የሚሰማ ድምፅ ብዙ ጊዜ ባትሪ ነው።

title: አላርም ተጠቃሚ
text: አላርም ለማሳወቂያ ነው። ምንጮችን ይቁሙ።

title: አየር ታሪክ
text: የአየር ታሪክ መመዝገብ የወቅቱን ጥራት ይጠቅማል።

title: ምግብ ጭስ
text: በምግብ ማብሰል ጊዜ ጭስ ይፈጠራል። መናፈሻ አድርጉ።

title: እንስሳት እና አየር
text: እንስሳት ከጭስ እና CO ይጎዳሉ። አየርን ንጹህ ያድርጉ።

title: ሕፃናት እና አየር
text: ሕፃናት በተለይ ለ PM እና CO ይጎዳሉ።

title: አረጋውያን
text: አረጋውያን አላርም ግን ማየት አለባቸው።

title: ትንሽ አሳማ
text: የምድጃን ቦታ ከእንስሳት አርቀው ይያዙ።

title: ስሞክ አደጋ
text: ስሞክ ከፍተኛ ሲሆን አላርም ይደርሳል።

title: ካንድል አደጋ
text: ካንድል ማብራት የ PM እና CO₂ ምንጭ ነው።

title: ኢንሰንስ ጭስ
text: ኢንሰንስ ጭስ ትንንሽ ቅንጣት ይፈጥራል።

title: የእርጥበት ጉዳይ
text: ከፍተኛ እርጥበት እንደ እምቡጥ ይደርሳል። ዝቅተኛ እርጥበት ደረቅ አየር ይሰጣል።

title: በአደጋ ጊዜ ማነጽ
text: አደጋ ሲከሰት መስኮቶችን ይክፈቱ፣ አየር ያስገቡ።

title: ማጣሪያ አስፈላጊነት
text: ማጣሪያ አልጋ ትቢያን ይቀንሳል።

title: ምንጭ ማቆም
text: አደጋ ሲታይ የጋዝ እቃዎችን ይዝጉ።

title: ሙቀት ምክንያት
text: ከፍተኛ ሙቀት ከእሳት ጋር ይዛመዳል።

title: አየር እና ጤና
text: ንጹህ አየር የጤና መሰረት ነው።

title: ባትሪ ምክንያት
text: ባትሪ ዝቅተኛ ሲሆን አላርም ድምፅ ይሰማል።

title: አየር ታሪክ ምክንያት
text: የታሪክ መመዝገብ አደጋን ያሳያል።

title: በምግብ ላይ ትኩረት
text: ምግብን እንዳትተዉት ይጠንቀቁ።

title: አየር መከታተያ
text: የምድጃ እና አየር መሳሪያዎችን በመከታተል አደጋን ይቀንሱ።

title: አደጋ ማስታወቂያ
text: አላርም ቀጥታ አደጋን ያሳያል።

title: እንቅልፍ ጥራት
text: ከፍተኛ የ CO₂ በሌሊት እንቅልፍ ይወድቃል።

title: ጭስ ችግኝ
text: ጭስ እንስሳትን እና ሕፃናትን ይጎዳል።

title: ጋዝ ችግኝ
text: ጋዝ መሳሪያ ሲቀር አደጋ ነው።

title: አየር እና ምቾት
text: ተመጣጣኝ አየር በቤት ውስጥ ምቾት ይሰጣል።

title: አየር እና ጤና ጉዳይ
text: የጭስ እና PM2.5 ከፍተኛ ከሆነ አደጋ ይመጣል።

title: አየር ቁጥጥር
text: ስህተት ሲታይ ሴንሰር ይምረምሩ።

title: ካሊብሬሽን
text: ሴንሰርን በንጹህ አየር ውስጥ ያስተካክሉ።

title: አየር ስርዓት
text: አየርን በቀጥታ መከታተል ይጠቅማል።

title: አየር ትንታኔ
text: አየር ታሪክ መመዝገብ ማሻሻያ ያስገኛል።

title: አደጋ እርዳታ
text: አደጋ ቢከሰት አስቸኳይ አገልግሎት ይደውሉ።

title: የጭስ አደጋ
text: ከፍተኛ ጭስ እና የ PM አደጋ ነው።

title: አየር ማስተካከያ
text: ስምንት ወር በኋላ ሴንሰርን ይቀይሩ።

title: የምድጃ አስተሳሰብ
text: ምድጃን ከፍተኛ ሲሆን በማስታወቂያ ይዘጋል።

title: አላርም አስተዳደር
text: አላርምን በደንብ ያስተዳድሩ።

title: SHEGA አጋዥ
text: SHEGA አጋዥ የቤት ውስጥ አየር ጥራትን ይመርምራል፣ አደጋን ያሳያል እና ምክር ይሰጣል።
